instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message:
Hi, 
i have this macbook air with problem on the display (external & internal) black screen no image but i see the backlight.
I have chime on start, fan turn, no liquid spill on the board very clean.
I check <SIGNAL>PP3_V3S0SW_LCD_UF</SIGNAL>=3,35V , <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>=22V.
i check resistor near lcd connector, all is good.
I don't know where check? 
thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message: Black screen is normal before "?" appears. Did you disconnect the SSD and do a PRAM reset?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message: without ssd and alt button press, always nothing on the screen, i make PRAM same issue. I wait 2 minute too same.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message: Try another BIOS, save the old!

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message: when you said try another bios, i take the component on another board? just to test?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message: yes, if this works upload your original bios file to be fixed.....

threads.message:
I need to test with BIOS of same board or BIOS of <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is same? i haven't same.
i upload the bios file, can you see if was problem on the file? please

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message:
Ok now with your rom, i have LCD without SSD but with black screen.
i don't understand before, i'm sure i test without ssd.
Do you have a method to program the bios without remove component?
i try to restore the old bios?
thanks

yes, i press alt i can see the wifi selector.
Do you have a method to program the bios without remove component?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message: Only if you have a special connector which you don't, so just pull the chip again. Upload the original dump here to be fixed.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message:
No Title

i reprogram the bios with the original dump, now work with a new ssd :(.
But the fan go full speed. i have an error on the fin stack sensor, where is this sensor?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message: Fin stack sensor is on IO board. Try a known good IO board and flat cable and inspect connector for corrosion.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video but backlight
threads.message: i change the flat cable and now work well, thanks duke
